item.title: Condemning the murder of Army Private William Long and the wounding of Army Private Quinton Ezeagwula, who were shot outside the Army Navy Career Center in Little Rock, Arkansas on June 1, 2009.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6665-6666; text as passed Senate: CR S6666; text of measure as introduced: CR S6656)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S6665-6666; text as passed Senate: CR S6666; text of measure as introduced: CR S6656)

summary.text:
Offers the condolences of the Senate to the family of Private William Andrew "Andy" Long (who was shot outside the Army Navy Career Center in Little Rock, Arkansas, on June 1, 2009).

Hopes for a full recovery for Private Quinton Ezeagwula (who was wounded in the shooting).

Urges swift prosecution to the fullest extent of the law of the perpetrator or perpetrators of this senseless shooting.

Urges the people of the United States to join the Senate in condemning acts of violence.

Honors the service and sacrifice of all men and women in the Armed Forces who protect and defend our freedom every day.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Offers the condolences of the Senate to the family of Private William Andrew "Andy" Long (who was shot outside the Army Navy Career Center in Little Rock, Arkansas, on June 1, 2009).

Hopes for a full recovery for Private Quinton Ezeagwula (who was wounded in the shooting).

Urges swift prosecution to the fullest extent of the law of the perpetrator or perpetrators of this senseless shooting.

Urges the people of the United States to join the Senate in condemning acts of violence.

Honors the service and sacrifice of all men and women in the Armed Forces who protect and defend our freedom every day.

bill.title: A resolution condemning the murder of Army Private William Andrew "Andy" Long and the wounding of Army Private Quinton Ezeagwula, who were shot outside the Army-Navy Career Center in Little Rock, Arkansas on June 1, 2009.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
